comment.author: 31716342@N00
comment._content: Is this the tail of a PB-4Y?

comment.author: 18532986@N07
comment._content: By the serial number on the tail it is a B-24D-53-CO Liberator (42-40355). It was damaged in crash on February 17,1943 (6 fatalities). The remains of the plane were transfered back to Consolidated and used to make the prototype for the C-87 Liberator Express transport. You can see the cargo doors in place of the waist gun position.

comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: The only trouble is, that doesn't explain the tall, single fin empennage on a C-87... but here it is in black & white!
